alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 1:58PM EDT until April 15 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Southeastern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 157 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over East Bangor, or 13 miles north of Easton, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. * Locations impacted include... East Stroudsburg, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, East Bangor, Stormville, Henryville, Werry Lake, Analomink, Delaware Water Gap, Columbia, Echo Lake, Stroudsburg, Roseto, Portland, Arlington Heights, Shawnee, Marshalls Creek and Hidden Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 306 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
